intro: Saussurea orgaadayi f. racemosa, commonly known as the Himalayan spurge or Himalayan saffron, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine. Its flowers are often used in local remedies for their anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects. The plant thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to the extreme conditions of its mountainous habitat.
